p: The effect of different doses within each treatment compared with control was analyzed as a randomized block design using the MIXED procedure of SAS (v.9.4 SAS Institute, Inc., Cary, NC, USA). The dose was the fixed effect and the period (block) was the random effect. Treatment means were compared to the control using the Dunnettâ€™s multiple comparison test [ 25], and were declared significant at p < 0.05, and 0.05 < p < 0.10 was considered a tendency. All means are reported as least squares means.
